page.title: 06Cliffe Common - Conservation
page.content: The Nature Conservancy Council has advised Cliffe Parish Council on two pieces of land it owns. {1. Broad Lane Wood. }This should have a hedge along its northern side to provide shelter and a barrier against spray drift. The hazel bushes are smothering ground plants and should be coppiced. There are few young trees, and some of the seedling oaks growing along the edge should be moved into cleared areas. {2. Ponds.}There are three shallow ponds in a field near the crossroads on Cliffe Common. These are rare in areas of intensive farming, and they have a lot of wildlife, including frogs, toads and newts. Large dead branches need removing, and herbicide sprays and inorganic fertilisers should not be used near the ponds.
